physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Suspicious nodule of more than 2 cm in diameter in the thyroid gland; multiple bilaterally enlarged lymph nodes in the neck.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Tumor recurred in a lymph node on the right side two years later, underwent unilateral dissection. Follow-up scans indicated persistent uptake of iodine-131 in the lungs despite treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No scintigraphic or radiological remnants of pulmonary metastases; thyroglobulin concentration decreased to 17 ng/mL; mild pulmonary fibrosis seen on lung CT; reduced pulmonary function.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially high thyroglobulin concentration of 3750 ng/mL after surgery decreased considerably, indicating a stable partial response.
